perturbation.original_text: The Agent will use commercially reasonable efforts on behalf of the Company in connection with the Agent's services hereunder. No offers or sales of the Offered Shares shall be made to any person without the prior approval of such person by the Company, such approval to be at the reasonable discretion of the Company.
perturbation.changed_text: The Agent will use best efforts on behalf of the Company in connection with the Agent's services hereunder. No offers or sales of the Offered Shares shall be made to any person without the prior approval of such person by the Company, such approval to be at the absolute discretion of the Company.
perturbation.explanation: Changing 'commercially reasonable efforts' to 'best efforts' imposes a higher standard of performance on the Agent, while altering 'reasonable discretion' to 'absolute discretion' gives the Company unrestricted control over approving potential buyers. This creates a conflict, as the Agent must now exert maximum effort to fulfill sales, but the Company's unfettered approval power can hinder these efforts, leading to potential disputes over performance expectations.

perturbation.original_text: The Transaction Entities will pay all expenses incident to the performance of their obligations under this Agreement and all the costs and expenses in connection with the offering of the Offered Shares including but not limited to (A) any filing fees and other expenses incurred in connection with qualification of the Offered Shares for sale under the laws of such jurisdictions as the Agent designate and the preparation and printing of blue sky surveys or legal investment surveys relating thereto, (B) costs and expenses related to the review by the Financial Industry Regulatory Authority, Inc. ("FINRA") of the Offered Shares (including filing fees and the fees and expenses of counsel for the Agent relating to such review), (C) costs and expenses of legal counsel for the Agent incurred in connection with this Agreement and the offering of the Offered Shares not to exceed $35,000, (D) costs and expenses of the Company relating to investor presentations and any road show in connection with the offering and sale of the Offered Shares, if any, including, without limitation, (1) any travel expenses of the Company's officers and employees and (2) any other expenses of the Company, including all actually and reasonably incurred costs and expenses of the Agent advanced on behalf of the Company relating to the investor presentations and any roadshow in connection with the offering and sale of the Offered Shares, (E) the fees and expenses incident to listing the Offered Shares and Conversion Shares on the NYSE MKT, (F) expenses incurred in distributing the Prospectus (including any amendments and supplements thereto) to the Agent, (G) expenses incurred for preparing, printing and distributing any Issuer Free Writing Prospectuses to investors or prospective investors, (H) stamp duties, similar taxes or duties or other similar fees or charges, if any, incurred by the Agent in connection with the offering and sale of the Offered Shares;  provided,  however that the Transaction Entities shall have no obligation to pay any costs and expenses of the Agent relating to the investor presentations and any roadshow in connection with the offering and sale of the Offered Shares, other than costs and expenses advanced on behalf of the Company in accordance with (D) above.
perturbation.changed_text: The Transaction Entities will pay all reasonable expenses incident to the performance of their obligations under this Agreement and all the necessary costs and expenses in connection with the offering of the Offered Shares including but not limited to (A) any filing fees and other expenses incurred in connection with qualification of the Offered Shares for sale under the laws of such jurisdictions as the Agent reasonably designate and the preparation and printing of blue sky surveys or legal investment surveys relating thereto, (B) costs and expenses related to the review by the Financial Industry Regulatory Authority, Inc. ("FINRA") of the Offered Shares (including filing fees and the fees and expenses of counsel for the Agent relating to such review), (C) costs and expenses of legal counsel for the Agent incurred in connection with this Agreement and the offering of the Offered Shares not to exceed $50,000, (D) costs and expenses of the Company relating to investor presentations and any road show in connection with the offering and sale of the Offered Shares, if any, including, without limitation, (1) any travel expenses of the Company's officers and employees and (2) any other expenses of the Company, including all actually incurred costs and expenses of the Agent advanced on behalf of the Company relating to the investor presentations and any roadshow in connection with the offering and sale of the Offered Shares, (E) the fees and expenses incident to listing the Offered Shares and Conversion Shares on the NYSE MKT, (F) expenses incurred in distributing the Prospectus (including any amendments and supplements thereto) to the Agent, (G) expenses incurred for preparing, printing and distributing any Issuer Free Writing Prospectuses to investors or prospective investors, (H) stamp duties, similar taxes or duties or other similar fees or charges, if any, incurred by the Agent in connection with the offering and sale of the Offered Shares;  provided,  however that the Transaction Entities shall have no obligation to pay any excessive costs and expenses of the Agent relating to the investor presentations and any roadshow in connection with the offering and sale of the Offered Shares, other than costs and expenses advanced on behalf of the Company in accordance with (D) above.
perturbation.explanation: By changing 'all expenses' to 'all reasonable expenses', 'all the costs and expenses' to 'all the necessary costs and expenses', 'Agent designate' to 'Agent reasonably designate', increasing the maximum legal counsel cost from '$35,000' to '$50,000', 'all actually and reasonably incurred costs and expenses' to 'all actually incurred costs and expenses' and by changing 'no obligation to pay any costs and expenses' to 'no obligation to pay any excessive costs and expenses', it creates ambiguity. The term 'reasonable', 'necessary' and 'excessive' lacks clarity, leading to disputes over which expenses are legitimately covered. An external auditor may have a different determination on what is 'necessary' and 'reasonable', while entities may have different definitions as well. This contradiction affects the financial obligations of the transaction entities and could lead to financial disputes.

perturbation.original_text: The Agent may in its sole discretion waive compliance with any conditions to the obligations of the Agent hereunder.
perturbation.changed_text: The Agent shall not waive compliance with any conditions to the obligations of the Agent hereunder.
perturbation.explanation: By changing 'The Agent may in its sole discretion waive compliance with any conditions' to 'The Agent shall not waive compliance with any conditions', it removes the agent's discretion, effectively setting up conflicting statements of Agent obligations/power throughout the contract. The agreement could have other sections that describe or assume the agent does have discretion.
